definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated

sentences.english: Capital flight is putting pressure on the peso.
sentences.chinese: 資本戰爭給予比索施加了很大壓力。

sentences.english: This symbol appeared on the Peso, and looked much like the modern $ sign.
sentences.chinese: 這一符號出現在比索上，很像今天$這一符號。

sentences.english: In order to build investor confidence, the escudo was fixed to the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 爲了建立投資者的信任，比索與美元掛鉤。

sentences.english: Barsac is maybe a little bit less liquorous and more fruity than Sauternes.
sentences.chinese: 巴爾薩克比索甸更帶有一點烈酒味，也更富有水果味。

sentences.english: The colón was introduced in 1896, replacing the Costa Rican peso.
sentences.chinese: 科郎於1896年開始採用，代替哥斯達黎加比索。

sentences.english: Objective To observe the effect of bisoprolol in congestive heart failure.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察比索洛爾治療心力衰竭的療效。

sentences.english: Bisoli broke club records in terms of fewest goals conceded and points attained.
sentences.chinese: 比索利打破了球隊的最少失球和最多積分記錄。

definition: peso (currency in Latin America) (loanword)/also written 比索[bi3 suo3]
krone (currency of Norway, Denmark, Iceland and Sweden) (loanword)
